subject: How to enable/disable JUnit tests programatically ?
msgSnippet: I am using JUnit 4.6 with ANT. I would like to filter out some tests at runtime if the running machine is not online. And to avoid, tight coupling I would like
messageBody:
I am using JUnit 4.6 with ANT. I would like to filter out some tests at runtime if the running machine is not online. And to avoid, tight coupling I would like to avoid to hardcode in the ANT file which tests to enable/disable.

Ideally I would like to define a custom attribute to my tests such as @RequireOnline and configure all the Junit runners (incl Parameterized) to filter out these tests based on my custom meta data on the test and the online/offline-state calculated at runtime.

Is something like this possible?

Thanks,
Morten
